comment:
Overall he's a nice professor and tends to asks us to take votes on when we'd like our assignments due but he's a really tough grader (wants you to write like an academic scholar) 
Class is discussion based so you HAVE to read the articles before class
You'll be asked to write lots of papers ranging from 400-1000 words (about 5)

Very picky (and slow) grader but he doesn't make his own criteria clear. The actual content is easy and he's friendly, but his grading is all over the place and it's difficult to get an A even if you take all his feedback into account.

The class itself is easy but only has a few assignments for this class (all of which are group/partner based) 
Does lecture based lessons which are a little boring but u must show up for participation credit and if the whole class does bad on an assignment he will over REDO's 
Tough grader - his expectations sometimes don't align with the rubric

He was flexible in this course and asked us to vote on assignments/projects to accommodate our preferences. There were a lot of online quizzes that asked questions from the textbook, but they were short and easy. There were some major assignments and 1 final research project at the end. He also gave us opportunities to improve our grades.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Provides very vague and passive-aggressive feedback. On top of that, his feedback is most likely late. His instructions are never clear for his super detailed assignments, he relies solely on the textbook to teach an online class. Expect a lot of group work. He is also not timely with grading or responding to emails. Not a good professor overall.

Arbitrary, capricious grader;  sometimes provides useful feedback, but often just grades harshly with little explanation.  Does not provide ANY online lectures for remote learners, yet expects his students to read his mind as to his  personal stylistic preferences. Expect many, many group projects with compressed timelines and brutal grading.

The reviews about Dr. Arnett on this site scared me but my experience with him was overall positive. Arnett values hard work, care, and participation.... if you display those qualities you will do fine in his class. TIP: try to adhere to his attendance policy, it can affect your grade. Also extra points if you participate in class!

Splits you up into groups in every class. If you miss more than 3 classes he will dock 5 points off of your final grade for every other absence regardless of reasoning (he includes drop add week even if you weren't in the course yet). He's really a professor on a power trip. Honestly, his class made me change my major to get away from his classes.

This is a technical writing class and by definition technical writing should be clear and concise. This class is anything but that. This teacher is very unorganized and grades by feeling. He provides an online textbook which is not helpful as his standards are different than the textbook. The group work is terrible avoid this at all cost!

SO MUCH HOMEWORK. he takes off points for EVERYTHING and grades so harshly but barely provides clarification on what he wants. for one of my assignments, he word for word said "this was not on the rubric for grading but..." and then proceeded to take off 10+ points . worst class I have ever taken in my 4 yrs of college. TAKE SOMEONE ELSE.

Easily the worst class I've ever taken. He deducts points for ridiculous things, like turning in assignments too close to the due date, for example. Why not move the due date rather than penalize students for doing things on time per YOUR syllabus? He seems more interested in appearing clever or tricky than actually teaching.

Dr. Arnett was is one of the better professors i've had. He went into great detail and always took the time to answer questions and make sure we understand the material. He posts all material on his own website which can be annoying not to have on d2l. He also helped write the textbook and provides it online for free.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Good professor. Tough grader. But he has an absurd attendance policy. I was passing with a high B but he said I was no longer eligible to pass, two weeks before summer semester is to be over, because of missing class. It's a stupid policy, especially if a student is paying for class and is passing. Why punish a passing student? It's only TCOM.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you value your grades, avoid this teacher. He is very detail oriented and even submitting a paper in the wrong format can cost you half or all of your grade. Big group project at the end that counts for 60% of your grade. I lost 10% of my grade because I didn't submit a peer review. He grades very tough and just is not clear about grading.

I loved this class and the Professor. I found everything that he taught us to be really helpful with writing  and relevant to the other classes that I was taking. He is a hard grader, and he expects you to do your homework and participate in class but if you do these things and work hard you can definitely get an A.

His class is easy until the last 2 projects which equal 60% of your grade! He already has you trapped by then and does not give very many A's. He finds mistakes on purpose and acts like he knows everything about computers and grammar.

Dr. Arnett is just a big slice of champeroni pizza. He is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. His assignments are not too hard, but there are a lot of them. Very helpful professor and explains everything clearly. I would definitely take him again if I could.

I took him for TCOM, he is very into tcom and is also a good teacher.  I received a B+ for my efforts.  60% of my grade was based off of GROUP assignments.  I think that is BS.  I had a 96 all through the semester til I got stuck with dumb and dumber.  My grade dropped ten points even though I tried dearly to make the A.

HE IS ONE OF THE BEST TEACHERS AT SPSU!!! HE MAKE HIS ASSIGNMENTS EASY TO UNDERSTAND AND IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS JUST EMAIL HIM AND HE WILL GET BACK WITH YOU QUICKLY. I WOULD TAKE HIM AGAIN IF I NEEDED TO!!!
He's an alright teacher, but he grades EXTREMELY tough. In my opinion, too tough for this class level. I would avoid him if possible.
Pretty good professor, extremely good at what he does. Sometimes a little hard on things but over all I'd refer him to anyone.

By far, one of the best professors I've had at SPSU. I hate english and writing classes, but he makes class fun. The assignments are quite interesting, and he lets you choose your topics to an extent. The final project took a lot of time, but well worth the experience I got out of it.

I put a lot of effort into my speeches for this class (public speaking). I still got a C. I at least deserved a B. There is no way I should have got a C. Attendance policy is ridiculous for college. 5% or your final grade is taken off for every absence past his free absence. He even counted my absence before I was enrolled in the class.

Attendance policy is a bit ridiculous, but if you can get over that, his knowledge of, uh, TCOM, is very extensive. He grades pretty hard too, but I got an A. His final paper was a little lengthy and a ton of work, but that had more to do with my group slacking off.

If you want TCOM to be your life, you should take his class. Most of his homework assignments are due at midnight. You'll have an homework or a project to work on after every class. He won't cut you any slack and doesn't listen to any excuses. He's not an easy grader and is very unclear in his directions. Take someone else if you can.

Very good teacher. He makes sure you know everything about every topic you cover. Attendance is mandatory but I don't blame him for requiring it, you would definitely fall behind with out going to class. When he teaches everything it to the point and it's pretty easy to understand. The assignments are a bit on the hard side, he requires a lot.

Going to his class is IMPORTANT !! 5% off each time you're not there. I hated the group assignments, you don't get to pick your groups. Don't except him to give you extra points for borderline grades like 89.

Where to start...this guy wants to be respected so much that he actually deducts 5 points from your final grade if you miss his class (like its so important). if your late - its an absence(or in some cases a zero)...he should probably be teaching high school where attendance is enforced by law so that his feelings wont get hurt.

this guy makes you line up by your height or what you ate for breakfast to assign you to a group assignment. his attendance policy is rediculous. you cant earn points for attending, but you can loose them. this is college, not highschool. we had 3 weeks of "workshop" class periods where we work on assignments in class and MUST show up in order not
